fr.atis_lab.physicalworld

Class PhysicalWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.atis_lab.physicalworld.PhysicalWorld
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class PhysicalWorld
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    PhysicalWorld is a wrapper around JBox2D World, adding some walls and a PhysicalObject list
    PhysicalWorld use org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 for its coordinate
    Version:
    12/2013
    Author:
    A. Gademer
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PhysicalWorld(Vec2 gravity, float xmin, float xmax, float ymin, float ymax, java.awt.Color borderColor)
      Create a world from gravity, dimensions and wall colors

    • Constructor Detail

      • PhysicalWorld

        public PhysicalWorld(Vec2 gravity,
             float xmin,
             float xmax,
             float ymin,
             float ymax,
             java.awt.Color borderColor)
        Create a world from gravity, dimensions and wall colors
        Parameters:
        gravity - Gravity vector
        xmin - minimum coordinate for x axis
        xmax - maximum coordinate for x axis
        ymin - minimum coordinate for y axis
        ymax - maximum coordinate for y axis
        borderColor - color of the border, null if invisible border

      • addCircularObject

        public Body addCircularObject(float radius,
                     BodyType type,
                     Vec2 position,
                     float orientation,
                     Sprite sprite)
                       throws InvalidSpriteNameException
        Add a circular object to the PhysicalWorld
        Parameters:
        radius - the radius of the circular shape
        type - determine if the object is mobile (BodyType.DYNAMIC) or static (BodyType.STATIC)
        position - the coordinate of the PhysicalObject
        orientation - the orientation angle (in radians) of the PhysicalObject
        sprite - the associated Sprite
        Throws:
        InvalidSpriteNameException - if the name was already used

      • addRectangularObject

        public Body addRectangularObject(float width,
                        float height,
                        BodyType type,
                        Vec2 position,
                        float orientation,
                        Sprite sprite)
                          throws InvalidSpriteNameException
        Add a rectangular object to the PhysicalWorld
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the rectangular shape
        height - the height of the rectangular shape
        type - determine if the object is mobile (BodyType.DYNAMIC) or static (BodyType.STATIC)
        position - the coordinate of the PhysicalObject
        orientation - the orientation angle (in radians) of the PhysicalObject
        sprite - the associated Sprite
        Throws:
        InvalidSpriteNameException - if the name was already used

      • addPolygonalObject

        public Body addPolygonalObject(java.util.LinkedList<Vec2> vertices,
                      BodyType type,
                      Vec2 position,
                      float orientation,
                      Sprite sprite)
                        throws InvalidPolygonException,
                               InvalidSpriteNameException
        Add a polygonal object to the PhysicalWorld
        Parameters:
        vertices - a LinkedList of coordinates in COUNTERCLOCKWISE order.
        type - determine if the object is mobile (BodyType.DYNAMIC) or static (BodyType.STATIC)
        position - the coordinate of the PhysicalObject
        orientation - the orientation angle (in radians) of the PhysicalObject
        sprite - the associated Sprite
        Throws:
        InvalidPolygonException - if the vertices list is too short (<3) or too long
        InvalidSpriteNameException - if the name was already used

      • destroyObject

        public void destroyObject(java.lang.String name)
                   throws ObjectNameNotFoundException,
                          LockedWorldException
        Remove the body corresponding to the name from the World and destroy it
        Parameters:
        body - the body to destroy
        Throws:
        ObjectNameNotFoundException - if the name does not correspond to an object
        LockedWorldException - if you try to destroy the object during simulation step

      • destroyObject

        public void destroyObject(Body body)
                   throws LockedWorldException
        Remove the given body from the World and destroy it
        Parameters:
        body - the body to destroy
        Throws:
        LockedWorldException - if you try to destroy the object during simulation step
